text: it's one of those sad things in life
isn't it when some popcorn is just left
rattling at the bottom of the pan or
leftover the reason that popcorn pops is
that those holes the husks are
waterproof and inside there's a little
bit of water and then a lot of starch
when you heat up the popcorns what's
happening on the inside is let the
pressure and the temperature of cooking
the starch and the water is starting to
evaporate as it evaporates it expands so
some of the popcorn but us can't take it
anymore
pressure builds up the pressure builds
up and eventually the popcorn pops and
all the cooked starch makes this
beautiful shape but for those little
corn bits of popcorn left behind what
happened to them is that they had a leak
because the water could leak out while
it was heating up the pressure doesn't
build up on the inside the cooked starch

they will never become popcorn
